text: J. Wakefield El Jefe Hefeweizen is probably the best US brewed Hefe Ive had. Orange cloudy pour with light fruity notes on the nose and decent white head. Taste has moderate banana and coconut notes. El Jefe is no German Hefe but it isnt a bad Florida version.
Mais banana do que cravo, no paladar dulçor que lembra baunilha. Razoável para o estilo.

12/10/17. On tap at The Lodge, HHI. Hazy golden orange pour under a small khaki head. I fucken love hefes and coconut, so I was excited for this one. Turned out to be not bad. Light coconut aroma, mostly hefe aspects - soft wheat, some banana. Clean flavor, banana, a touch of spice, very mild coconut, not sure Id notice if I wasnt told so. I love coconut, so was hoping for more. Not bad.

Draught. Pours a murky, burnt gold with a large, lasting frothy white head. Aroma is coconut, clove, and bubblegum. Taste is coconut, spice, clove, bubblegum, and a touch of citrus. Light on the banana. Yeasty finish. Light-medium body. Moderate carbonation that is fine and slightly prickly. Slick-ish mouthfeel.
on tap pours golden small white head aroma of tropical fruits tast follows with sweet malts

Draft at the brewery. Pours opaque golden amber with a creamy off white head. Tastes like creamy wheat, coconut, sweet doughy malt, and tropical fruits. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like sweet doughy malt, coconut, and tropical fruits.

Tap at brewery. Pours hazy, bright orange. Aroma is coconut oil, wheat, faint yeast esters, and faint tropical fruit notes. Flavor matches the aroma with nice malt sweetness, huge coconut, tropical fruit, and nice pale malt base. Medium body.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 Tap. Moderate to heavy cereal for the malt, light to moderate herbs for the hops, heavy dough for the yeast, with coconut, clove, banana and a hint of bubblegum. Head is small, frothy, white, with some spotty lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is murky medium amber. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and slightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and faintly bitter. Palate is medium, slick with a soft to lively carbonation. A really nice German Hefeweizen with the addition of coconut.
On tap at OG Donor Party. Pours a cloudy orange yellow with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is yeast, wheat, clove, banana. Medium body, similar flavors to nose, light finish, good.
Taster at Dominion Wine and Beer. Pours a cloudy gold with an off white head. Light banana nose. Flavors of banana and cardamom. Smooth and tasty.

16oz pint at the brewery. Appearance: Deep golden and hazy, moderate white foam head. 
Aroma: Clove heavy, with a ligh banana bread. 
Taste: Starts with a sweet wheat maltiness, a light spicy clove and banana, and finishes with a moderately strong coconut to contrast the banana esters. 
Mouthfeel: On the lighter bodied side for a hefe, with a moderate carbonation. 
Finish: Leaves some pear esters and coconut after the swallow. Very pleasant. 
Overall: A nice take on a hefe with the added coconut for complexity against the fruity yeast esters. Maybe a little thin for the style, but still delivers a wide range of flavors and aromas, with the typically fruity yeast esters.
Light bubblegum and some clove and some light coconut, though hard to pick out from blind taste. Hazy golden pour with ok head. Light sweet finish. Tap at Rustico.
Draft at Rustico. Cloudy golden color. Weird aroma of clove and coconut. Taste is sour coconut. Odd oily mouthfeel. Interesting.

tap. Orange hazy with a firm white head. Loads of german hefe yeast in the nose, banana, some slight tropical fruits. Some slight fruits and spices but overall easy with subtle velvet yeasty layers, a bit strong on the banana but decent for the style
Draft. Orange pour with white head. Fruity, bubble gum, yeast and spice aromas and Flavors.
Draft at Capones. Hazy gold pour with white head. Some banana, clove, bubblegummy aromas, notes of pale malt in the flavor, smooth finish. Solid hefe.
On tap at Capones. Poured a cloudy golden color with a small sized head. Standard Hefe with nothing really standing out - yeast, cloves and bananas.
Pours a hazy orange with a thick white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, clove and coconut. Taste follows, solid hefe
One Mile House, New York tap: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is spicy, yeasty, bubblegum, and fruitiness. Taste is pretty sweet. Very light hoppy finish. It be kind of sugary. Not bad.

At Varga bar, Pours murky flat gold notes are Apple pieces, banana perfume and so much clovey Belgian yeast. Gross. Grandmas house at Christmas wit bier notes. Way too spiced and Belgiand out Yo. No balance or drinkability

Tap at taproom, Miami. Hazy orange color, small white head, lace. Aroma has banana, coconut and herbs. Medium-bodied. Flavor has strong coconut, banana and light citrus. Mellow unconventional hefeweizen.

This beer is really fucking good. This is the untreated version but there seems to be a very pleasant cocnut note underneath a tasty, juicy hefe. Its full bodied but light very flavorful and drinkable. A very nice take on a classic style. It is just a little different while still delivering everything you could want. I dig it.
Strong banana notes but still a very refreshing wheat. Very smooth finish.

Sampled at GABF 2015 with Andrew, Mel and Frank. Pours a deep orange amber body with thick white lacing. Medium to full-bodied hefe with no cloying notes of clove or weird spicy banana character - just mango, coconut and tea. Really good, non-traditional flavor profile for a hefeweizen.

Draft on tap at the OG Party (Miami, FL). Pours a deep darker amber orange hue, darker and hazy with some nice orange juice glow at times. Frothy whitish head with mellow layer atop, solid lacing as a decent ringer. Aromas are earth, dry, some banana and lemon mix into bready malts, wheat, and gentle yeastiness, subtle vanilla. Initial is fruity, lots of banana and subtle pineapple meet vanilla, bread and flaked wheat. Some sweetness, subtle spice, pie crust and yeastiness. Middle gives up body as those estery elements trail out. Some vanilla, faint honey, applecrisp, faint cinnamon and spice. Nice flavors, richer with firm pie crust sweetness at times. A bit full, sweeter at times but really fruity and subtle spicy at others. Interesting Hefe. Sweet overall. Fruity and potent nose, some sweeter flavors in the body. My wife would love this.

Keg @ Wakefield. Hazy soupy orange pour with a big white head. Looks a bit messy, to be honest. Total banana bomb on the nose. General clove. Sort of nutty, hints of citrus. Similar flavor. Somewhat sweet. Active carbonation. Decent.
Draft at source - pours yellow white head. nose/taste of banana, clove, wheat and light orange peel - medium body

GABF 2015. Lots of coconut flavor, some banana and bubblegum. Good, thick palate. I dont know about the coconut, I guess it works but this had enough quality as a regular hefeweizen it didnt need it. Big white head, they got the appearance right. One of the best American hefeweizens I have had in a long time.

Keg at CBC holburn. Hazed orange golden coloured pour with a off white frothy head. Aroma is nice white choc and cinnamon, chai tea. Flavour is nutty, hazelnut, custard, vanilla, cinnamon. Interesting take on a hefe. Palate is frothy and lively, highish carbonation.
Keg at CBC CG, London. hazy golden with medium white head. Nose is banana esters and light sweetness. Taste is banana sweet and some stone fruit. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good

Keg at CBC CG - London. Pours cloudy gold with a frothy white head. Nice doughy wheat in the nose, bubblegum, orange, banana. Medium sweet flavor with lightly toasted, sugary wheat, grain, light brown sugar, bruised banana. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sweet finish, more doughy wheat, aged banana, yeast. Nice hefe.

Tap at CBC CG. It pours cloudy golden - amber with medium white head. The nose is soft, creamy, custard creams, apple pie, vanilla and creme caramel. The taste is smooth, creamy, custard, white bread, apple pie, banana milkshake, clove and mild spice with a creamy finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Well-rounded creamy malted beverage.

GABF 2015. Cloudy yellow appearance with an off white head. Heavy banana and phenols. Vanilla and coconut. Moderately sweet. A little doughy. Its above average for the style but the yeast they use is awfully aggressive with the phenols and esters.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2017 My Bottom Line:
Coconut and pears whip up an aromatic and different Hefeweizen, helped by bready yeast, wheat and cushy residual sugars.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the cloudy beige.
-Carbonation is very low, sadly. This lowers drinkability in this case.
-Coconut is beautifully harmonious with pear-banana esters.
-Texture once again is rather carelessly done here, which seems to be the case for most Wakefield brews. Carbonate this like a proper Weissbier and youll get something special.
-A touch of orange is felt throughout.
-The pairing with Asian, soy-based seasonings is fantastic!.

On tap at the brewpub and at KYU (Miami).
Draft. Medium white head atop cloudy apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, coconut, banana. Taste is moderately sweet, banana cream pie, light lemon. Light-medium body, light stickiness.

Cloudy pale. Aroma is fairly straightforward yeasty stuff, but the palate is where this really rocks. Sweet, beautiful fresh coconut...not toasted...really nice. Not only brings an extra dimension to the table, in a way that seems very natural. Probably the biggest surprise at JWB, an innovative take on the style that is seamless.
On tap at the breewery. Pours a hazy orangey yellow with a white head. Kinda has some strange aroma that I cant place. Also bubble gum and banana. Dug it other than the weird scent.
Hazy orangish color, fluffy white head. Delicious. Great body, tons of banana, bubblegum, good yeasty qualities, bready notes. Really creamy and tasty. Nice job JW!

Ive drank a lot of Johns beers. This is the first time Im having one of his commercially brewed beers. Its merely ok. Too heavy a body for the style, and one note flavor wise with a popping bubblegum character. Lacks the complexity or consumability of a truly great hefeweizen (or the intrigue of something like Floridian).
On tap at the brewery. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Grain aromas. Creamy with light lemon zest, cereal, and corn notes. Clean and crisp. Good body and mouthfeel.

Draft on tap at the brewery after the Salesforce Higher Education conference. Pours a rich orange with big white head. Aroma is clove and slight banana. Taste is a very rich wheat forward hefeweizen with just a bit of coconut and definite banana. Im not sure if it is because of all the other fruit going on here but the banana was very apparent but very well balanced with the beer. Im not sure Ive had a better hefe in quite some time even though it is not my go to by any means.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Draft. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Fruity and yeasty, with quite a bit of estery banana notes, lighter spicy notes, mild sweetness, and a quick fruity finish. A step below some of the best German examples, but a damn fine beer, and a great base for the treatments. Very drinkable.
